cuisine_description_en: Cuisine of the Chinese disapora, including Taiwan and United States
Cantonese (Yuè, 粵) cuisine, from Southern China, is known for its signature smoky “wok hei” flavor, emphasis on fresh seafood, well-balanced sauces, and the rich tradition of dim sum.
Jiangnan cuisine, representing Eastern China (including Shanghai), is known for refined flavors and delicate textures as well as the use of freshwater ingredients.
Sichuan (Chuān, 川) cuisine, from Western China, is famous for its bold and spicy flavors, often featuring numbing Sichuan peppercorns and fiery chili peppers.
Shandong (Lu, 鲁) cuisine, representative of Northern China and imperial cuisine, is characterized by wheat-based staples like dumplings and noodles and the use of vinegars and fermented sauces.
